cs691.assignment04

Class PCAMethod

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs691.assignment04.PCAMethod
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ClusteringMethod

    public class PCAMethod
extends java.lang.Object
implements ClusteringMethod
    This class can be used to conduct the experiments in http://www.aaai.org/Papers/ICML/2003/ICML03-027.pdf regarding the PCA+EM algorithm (the baseline in their experiments). It should be used to verify that you have correctly implemented the methods in the Utils class before moving on to the more challenge ClusterEnsemble work.
    Author:
    sloscal1

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int emNumClusters
      The number of clusters to use in the EM algorithm.
      private int pcaComps
      The number of components to sue in PCA (set as in Table 3 of http://www.aaai.org/Papers/ICML/2003/ICML03-027.pdf )

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PCAMethod(int pcaComps, int emNumClusters)
      Given the desired dimensionality of the PCA-reduced data and the number of clusters to select when using EM, construct the PCA+EM algorithm object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      weka.core.Instances doPCA(weka.core.Instances data, int numComps)
      This method does a Principle Components Analysis on the given data to reduce its dimensionality down to the specified size.
      java.util.List<java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer>> getClusters(weka.core.Instances data, int run)
      The overall method to call from Experiment that follows the specific procedure in each of the implementing classes to get the clustering result given specific data and which run is being executed.

        public PCAMethod(int pcaComps,

    • Method Detail

      • doPCA

        public weka.core.Instances doPCA(weka.core.Instances data,
                                 int numComps)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        This method does a Principle Components Analysis on the given data to reduce its dimensionality down to the specified size.
        Parameters:
        data - a non-null data set to base the transformation on
        numComps - the desired resulting dimensionality of the transformation
        Returns:
        a new data set that has as many instances as the given data but with numComps number of attributes
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if soemthing goes wrong during the transformation

      • getClusters

        public java.util.List<java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer>> getClusters(weka.core.Instances data,
                                                                    int run)
                                                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: ClusteringMethod
        The overall method to call from Experiment that follows the specific procedure in each of the implementing classes to get the clustering result given specific data and which run is being executed.
        Specified by:
        getClusters in interface ClusteringMethod
        Parameters:
        data - must not be null
        run - (so far used to seed a random value)
        Returns:
        clustering result as used throughout this work
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - don't worry about properly handling these - if everything works and the input data is valid no exceptions should be thrown.
